column4: ok so im at my uncle's house, and i noticed that their copy of ubuntu was pretty old and needed a lot of updating
he was on karmic koala
since support is ended for karmic I hit upgrade to lynx, since its an LTS
three hours pass as its downloading and upgrading, then I come back and the screen is just saying "unsupported input", so i though "hmm" I'll reboot and see whats going on here
but on a straight reboot i just get too the ubuntu logo on a black screen, nothing else
so then I restarted in recovery mode
last thing that happens is that app armor profiles fail to load and then run-init: /sbin/init: I/O error
followed by kernel panic
at which point I did as told and paniced
so now I'm sitting here with my uncle and auntwanting to use the computer i just screwed by hitting update
it'll be quick :)
no, the updates
reboot, hold shift and select an older kernel
try booting to liveCD and fsck the partition as well as test your ram
then test ram from grub
d'oh. time for a new drive and a data restore
they don't have a backup?
like, seriously!?
thats fine, only the system drive is dying
btw your OS isn't to blame if the hardware physically dies
I guess, i will work the drive some
